titleStmt.author: Churchyard, Thomas

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the Honourable and right Reuerend Father in God, D. Bancraft, Bishop of London.
analytic.author: Churchyard, Thomas

monogr.title: Churchyards good will : Sad and heauy verses, in the nature of an epitaph, for the losse of the Archbishop of Canterbury, lately deceased, Primate and Metropolitane of all England. Written by Thomas Churchyard, Esquire
monogr.author: Churchyard, Thomas

div.head: To the Honourable and right Reuerend Father in God, D. Bancraft, Bishop of London.
div.p: MY good Lord, as Gods grace and high calling made you great, and in speciall fauour with the Rulers of this Land, and in that while, called your Lordship to be well liked of the late Archbishop of Canterbury, (for some your good vertues:) so I, in boldnesse of those good parts, dedicate to your Lordship, the life and death (in verse) of the matchlesse Archbishop of Canterbury, lately deceased.

closer.signed: Your Lordships at commaundement, Thomas Churchyard.
